data.title: Cheesecake Factory, PF Chang’s and 146 other restaurants we want to see at Harrisburg Mall site
data.meta_description: In March, we asked PennLive readers on our Facebook page “What restaurant would you like to see built on the site of the Harrisburg Mall?”
data.text:
Residents in the Harrisburg area want a Cheesecake Factory.

That’s pretty clear.

Whenever we’ve asked PennLive readers about what restaurants and stores they want to see open in the Harrisburg area, the Cheesecake Factory is always near or at the top of the list. And that’s still the case.

In March, we asked PennLive readers on our Facebook page “What restaurant would you like to see built on the site of the Harrisburg Mall?”

The Cheesecake Factory was by far the most popular choice.

But, PennLive readers also would like to see buffets, Brazilian steakhouses, fast food restaurants and everything in between. Some readers want Checkers, Kondu, Mother’s Subs and Taco Bell to come back to the mall site. Other readers want Starbucks and Qdoba to make a return to Paxton Street. And some readers apparently want a second Applebee’s at the site. Some also want to see Hoss’s make a return to Swatara Township. Some had realistic suggestions while others named longshots.

And there is plenty of space for multiple restaurants. St. John Properties, the owner of the site is demolishing the 55-year-old Harrisburg Mall on Paxton Street in Swatara Township and redeveloping a mixed-use development called the Swatara Exchange.

We know that Applebee’s is staying. So that’s restaurant #1. And we know that St. John Properties, the site owner is proposing a 3,195-square-foot restaurant for the site. So that’s restaurant #2. The developer is also proposing three retail buildings with drive-thru lanes and four large buildings with room for multiple tenants.

Here are the restaurants PennLive readers told us they want to see open on the site of the Harrisburg Mall:
